message_content: I am a former UNESCO staff and worked for the Ministry of Urban Development and Housing. Currently based in the US and working on my personal research topics.
I am a student at Kanazawa University in Japan. We would like to use this data for academic purposes.
extras:
{"country": "Japan", "organization_id": "kanazawa university", "organization_name": "kanazawa university", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "caveats": "Contributors: Cruz Vermelha de. Timor-Leste (CVTL), Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, Civil Protection Timor Leste, Contributors to the OpenStreetMap 2023, OSM Community Timor Leste", "creator_user_id": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "data_update_frequency": "-2", "dataset_date": "[2023-09-11T00:00:00 TO 2023-09-23T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre, Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, OpenStreetMap Contributors", "field_names": "OSM building footprint,critical infrastructures,floods,early warning,flood impacts,capacities", "file_types": "Excel Table,Shapefile,JSON", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": true, "id": "d52028c5-3327-4cd4-8838-e445253b8f34", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "metadata_created": "2023-12-16T19:14:35.666815", "metadata_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "OpenStreetMap Field Data Collection using KoboCollect & OSM remote mapping through the HOTOSM Tasking Manager", "name": "anticipatory-mapping-timor-leste", "notes": "This data package contains field data collected during anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste. The data collection focused on completing critical infrastructure mapping in the focus areas, collecting information of historic flood events, flood impacts, and early warnings. 
This data package is available upon request only due to containing household-level information. However, all structural building data has been directly imported into OpenStreetMap and is openly accessible.

The project involved several key stages:

•	Initial updates and completion of building footprints in OpenStreetMap in focus areas via remote mapping using satellite imagery before commencing field mapping.

•	Comprehensive mapping of all critical infrastructure buildings in designated areas, gathering bbuilding attributes like building use, names, etc.

•	Collection of specific building features indicating susceptibility to floods or other hazards, such as minimum foundation height and building materials.

•	Additionally, qualitative information on buildings' flood history was collected where individuals were present (e.g., 'Has this building been flooded in the past?'

•	In the Manatuto area, a subset of residential buildings was mapped alongside all critical infrastructure buildings.


Field mapping activities covered the following areas and dates:

•	Manatuto: September 11th to 15th, 2023 (1479 critical infrastructure & residential buildings mapped)

•	Raimea: September 18th, 2023 (27 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Uma Berloic: September 19th, 2023 (36 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Pante Macassar: September 21st to 22nd, 2023 (218 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)


The data package includes the following files:

1_Timor-Leste_AA_mapping_all areas.xlsx: 
Contains all collected, georeferenced data in raw and cleaned formats, along with a codebook.
2_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Buildingfootprint.zip & 3_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Building_footprint.json: 
Contain collected data joined to the OSM building footprint, updated via satellite mapping before field activities.

4_TimorLeste_KoboForm_Questions.pdf: 
Displays the questions and answer options used in the KoboCollect questionnaire for field data collection on historic flood events, impacts, and early warnings.

5_Final_Datamodel_Koboform_TimorLeste_AAmapping.xls: 
This table contains the data structure of the KoboCollect questionnaire. Importing this file into the KoboCollect toolbox allows to replicate the data collection.
6_OSM_Data_Model.pdf: 
This table offers an overview of the OpenStreetMap (OSM) data model and tags used for anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste, detailing how geographic objects are tagged with keys (e.g., "building") and values (e.g., “residential”) to describe their attributes.

{"country": "Ukraine", "organization_id": "Other", "organization_name": "Other", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "Other", "intend": "Research", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 62, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

{"country": "Ukraine", "organization_id": "ICRC", "organization_name": "ICRC", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "red_cross_red_crescent", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 32, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

{"country": "United Kingdom", "organization_id": "University of Oxford", "organization_name": "University of Oxford", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 77, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. The key-informant-based HSM methodology uses settlements as the unit of analysis, using a structured survey tool to interview key informants about the situation in their settlement. A sampling frame covering all 419 districts in Afghanistan was used, covering a minimum of 10% of total settlements in each district. To achieve geographical spread across each district, at least three key informant interviews (KIIs), in a number proportionate to the number of settlements, were conducted in each Basic Service Unit (BSU). To determine a BSU (defined as an economic/geographic service unit which relies on the same services, i.e. healthcare clinics and schools, and common public spaces, i.e. markets and roads), participatory mapping of settlements and services available was conducted prior to data collection. Any analysis conducted using the data in this file will generate statistically non-representative results, as the key informant methodology is indicative", "num_of_rows": 10635, "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 6, "organization": {"id": "8e8911ab-f35c-4189-9dce-8715002f723e", "name": "reach-initiative", "title": "REACH Initiative", "type": "organization", "description": "REACH facilitates the development of information tools and products that enhance the capacity of aid actors to make evidence-based decisions in emergency, recovery and development contexts. {"country": "Netherlands", "organization_id": "Netherlands Red Cross", "organization_name": "Netherlands Red Cross", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "international_org", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 82, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content: We would like to have access to this data source in order to have a better understanding of the health facilities in case of any incident during our operation in Ukraine. Currently we are using the information from OSM (Open Street Maps) but we have been detected a lot of mistakes on this data source.
IRY has many new health facilities to be constructed. We need to conduct studies like feasibility studies and community catchment. This my official email Mohammed.mftah@iryemen.org

message_content: We are conducting an Evaluation of IOM's project in Rohingya refugee camps in Bangladesh. In the project there was an indicator, "%of community members feel they are informed about the aid and services available for them". Since your study analyzed and documented result on similar indicator we want to compare and validate our finding with your result.

message_content:
Hi,
 
I am a student of Msc. in Data Science at the University of East London. I also work in the security sector in Kenya. I would like to use the data for research purposes especially to demonstrate the importance of integrating spatial data in analysing security data for intelligence-led operations.

message_content: HelpAge is producing country profiles on the rights and wellbeing of older persons. Would like to access the dataset to review its adequacy for analysis.
extras: {"country": "United Kingdom", "organization_id": "HelpAge", "organization_name": "HelpAge", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "international_ngo", "intend": "Advocacy", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "creator_user_id": "7711391a-7647-4432-a71b-294e7f901a2c", "data_update_frequency": "-1", "dataset_date": "[2019-06-01T00:00:00 TO 2019-08-31T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "Reach Initiative", "field_names": "District,pregnancy health,child vaccination,shelter,education level,settlement", "file_types": "xlsx", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "b6d5fa55-f9c7-4fa3-a2c5-e91c418179e2", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-06-07T11:03:11.241185", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "b5e46b7d-c868-4b5e-bc1f-d4cfdd2170c8", "metadata_created": "2019-09-17T08:48:22.958226", "metadata_modified": "2024-06-07T11:03:11.241185", "methodology": "Sample Survey", "name": "2019-somalia-joint-multicluster-needs-assessment", "notes": "Primary data will be collected by means of a household-level survey designed with the participation of the humanitarian clusters in Somalia. Cluster leads are asked to outline information gaps and the type of data required to inform their strategic plans. Key indicators are developed by REACH with the substantive input of participating partners, and subsequently validated by the clusters. REACH will draft the household survey tool through an iterative consultation process with cluster partners and OCHA and is aligned, as much as possible, with the Joint Inter-Sectoral Analysis Framework (JIAF) which will serve as a common and structured method for assessing the severity of needs across different clusters.\r\n\r\nThe assessment will use stratified cluster sampling at the district level using settlements as the clusters and households as the unit of measurement. For some districts, 2-stage stratified random sampling will be used instead of stratified cluster sampling for large urban centres, if it proves to be more efficient and logistically feasible for data collection. The sample will be stratified by population group, disaggregated by non-displaced communities, and IDP settlements; the sample will be further stratified by district to ensure coverage and comparison across the entire country (with the exception of inaccessible areas). In the case of cluster sampling, the minimum cluster size will be set to 6 households. message_content: I need this data for humanitarian uses

Dear Sir/Madam,

I would like to express my sincere gratitude for your consideration of my request.

I am a master‘s degree student specializing in urban studies at the Department of Architecture, School of Design, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, working under the supervision of Associate Professor Youlie, whose research focuses on the interrelationship between population dynamics, land use patterns, and fiscal policies in urban planning.

Currently, I am  conducting research on the changes in population-land-fiscal relationships across various regions of Ukraine resulting from the ongoing conflict. To support this academic endeavor, which I intend to publish a paper later, I am writing to respectfully request access to the official population statistics for Ukrainian regions for the year 2024.

I deeply appreciate your time in reviewing this request and would be extremely grateful if you could approve my application for access to this statistical information.

Thank you for your kind consideration.

Yours faithfully,

Mao Jiayang

May 14, 2025
extras:
{"country": "China", "organization_id": "Shanghai Jiao Tong University", "organization_name": "Shanghai Jiao Tong University", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 350, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

{"country": "Nepal", "organization_id": "Islington College", "organization_name": "Islington College", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "private_sector", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 497, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content:
My name is Kelly Jiang, and I am writing on behalf of the Sudan Independent Monitoring and Analysis Programme (SIMAP), which supports the British Office in Sudan conduct research across various themes.

Currently, SIMAP is designing a climate risk map based on currently available data to support better programmatic decisions within the FCDO portfolio, and we are particularly interested in datasets that could help us have a more precise understanding of what areas have greater risk.

{"country": "Ukraine", "organization_id": "World Health Organization", "organization_name": "World Health Organization", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "united_nations", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2025-07-15T23:59:59", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 513, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content: We are conducting a study in CAR that compares the behavior of food security indicators over time and looks at the relationship between the different food security indicators and the role of the contextual factors in explaining indicator behavior. We were able to download the MSNA datasets for all the other years from the impact-initiatives website but not this one. Please give us access to the data. Thank you!

It also aims to understand specific needs and vulnerabilities of population groups, namely non-displaced households, returnees, internally displaced persons (IDPs) living in host communities, and IDPs living at sites. 

The needs assessment covers protection, health, mental health, WASH, Shelter and NFI, Education, food security, livelihoods and disabilities, as well as the perception of and satisfaction with humanitarian aid (AAP).

The 2022 MSNA was conducted through a statistically representative household survey across 66 accessible sub-prefectures (admin2) out of the 72 sub-prefectures of the country. The inaccessible sub-prefectures were evaluated using a Key Informant survey. In consultation with key humanitarian partners and actors, a joint set of indicators, questions, and answer choices were developed for the assessment of needs in the context of the Central African Republic. All surveys were conducted through face-to-face interviews, using the tablet-based Kobo Collect Open Data Kit (ODK) app.

Household data collection took place from July 20 to September 18, 2022. A total of 12,347 households were assessed after data cleaning. Data is statistically representative at a 92% confidence level and a +/- 10% margin of error with a buffer of 10% for the entire population on the level of sub-prefectures (admin2) and higher levels, and for specific population groups on the level of prefectures (admin1) and higher levels.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 8, "organization": {"id": "8e8911ab-f35c-4189-9dce-8715002f723e", "name": "reach-initiative", "title": "REACH Initiative", "type": "organization", "description": "REACH facilitates the development of information tools and products that enhance the capacity of aid actors to make evidence-based decisions in emergency, recovery and development contexts. message_content:
Hello, I am a Syrian medical student studying in the University of Debrecen, Hungary. I am currently working with the Department of Preventive Medicine and Epidemiology and we would like to research noncommunicable diseases within the Syrian population or population of Syrian refugees in other countries. Furthermore, we would like to base our research on a public database, and Malnutrition would be a very interesting topic to talk about.
Thank you in advance.

message_content: I am a PhD student developing an urban growth model for Peru, with the goal of quantifying the population exposed to natural hazards. To support this work, I am actively collecting a wide range of relevant input data from diverse sources.

Muestreo deliberado e intencional en muelles, albergues, centros de recepci\u00f3n y espacios p\u00fablicos (playa)", "name": "impact-reach-crs-fronteras-en-movimiento-evaluacion-transfronteriza-de-necesidades", "notes": "En los \u00faltimos a\u00f1os, los flujos migratorios en Am\u00e9rica Latina y el Caribe han incrementado y se han diversificado considerablemente como consecuencia, entre otros factores, de la crisis migratoria venezolana, los graves y prolongados efectos econ\u00f3micos y sociales de la pandemia del Covid-19, y la creciente inflaci\u00f3n e inseguridad alimentaria que se vive en la regi\u00f3n.  A partir del \u00e9xodo de m\u00e1s de 7 millones de venezolanos, distintos pa\u00edses de la regi\u00f3n que no ten\u00edan una tradici\u00f3n migratoria establecida se han convertido en lugar de tr\u00e1nsito y recepci\u00f3n de personas provenientes de este pa\u00eds.  En la mayor\u00eda de pa\u00edses de acogida, la poblaci\u00f3n venezolana no ha alcanzado un estatus regular, enfrenta dificultades de integraci\u00f3n y xenofobia, y no cumple con requisitos legales de ingreso, por lo que frecuentemente utiliza pasos irregulares.  En los dos \u00faltimos a\u00f1os, la migraci\u00f3n proveniente de Venezuela a pa\u00edses de la regi\u00f3n continu\u00f3, si bien se evidenciaron cambios en su movilidad, entre los que se encuentran: movimientos de retorno a Venezuela, flujos multidireccionales y migraciones secundarias a otros destinos del hemisferio.  Durante este periodo han aumentado dram\u00e1ticamente los movimientos desde Suram\u00e9rica a Estados Unidos a trav\u00e9s del Tap\u00f3n del Dari\u00e9n, en la frontera colombo-paname\u00f1a: en los tres primeros meses de 2023, este flujo alcanz\u00f3 un n\u00famero r\u00e9cord, con m\u00e1s de 100.000 personas entradas irregulares a Panam\u00e1 registradas, la mayor\u00eda de las cuales eran de nacionalidad venezolana, haitiana, y ecuatoriana, as\u00ed como poblaci\u00f3n extracontinental. message_content:
Subject: Excited to Join the Community!

Dear Administrator 

I hope this message finds you well! I’m eager to join this data  because I believe it’s a fantastic platform for like-minded individuals to connect, share, and grow together. 

I am particularly drawn to the group’s focus on datasets , and I’m excited about the opportunity to contribute my insights and learn from others. I am confident that my passion for datasets] aligns well with the group's goals.

Thank you for considering my request to join. I look forward to being a part of this vibrant community!

Warm regards,

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 531, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content:
WHO CO in Ukraine plans to conduct 2025 Summer Risk Assessment, following the approach used for the 2024-2025 Winter Risk Assessment (https://www.who.int/europe/publications/i/item/WHO-EURO-2024-2946-42704-59552)published last year. One of the key datasets we used previously was the UNFPA 2023 population estimate.

Can we kindly ask you to share with WHO CO in Ukraine latest available UNFPA population estimates dataset?

message_content: I'm a senior at Harvard working on a final project for my GIS analysis class. I'm hoping to combine this dataset with some spatial data of Uganda and some additional data about refugees in Uganda in order to construct a social vulnerability index for refugees in Uganda. Thank you for your consideration!

message_content: District prioritization for education intervention

I am a student researcher at the Geneva Graduate Institute, currently conducting an Applied Research Project in collaboration with IMPACT Initiatives. The project focuses on the Areas of Knowledge (AoK) methodology in the Syrian Arab Republic.
As part of my analysis, I aim to assess how the minimum viable sample size required to maintain statistical robustness may change when sampling strategies are based on settlement size and geographic stratification.
To support this work, I kindly request access to the most recent baseline population dataset for the Syrian Arab Republic. The dataset will be used exclusively for academic purposes to enhance the statistical design and relevance of our needs assessment models.
Thank you very much for your consideration. Please let me know if any additional information is required.

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. message_content:
The Ministry of Economy of Ukraine is requesting access to the COD-PS 2024 dataset to support a range of analytical and policy development tasks essential to Ukraine’s recovery process. The data will be used to prepare analytical materials on demographic trends, assess the current state of the population, and develop strategic measures in response to the ongoing demographic challenges the country is facing. These analyses will inform national-level decision-making and contribute to the preparation of publications, presentations, and recommendations that support policy planning and implementation.

Access to detailed demographic data is also required to support institutional research efforts, including the design of representative samples, population stratification, and the validation of survey methodologies. The data will enable comprehensive analysis of the social structure of the population, including age, gender, family composition, and regional distribution, and will facilitate the study of dynamic processes such as aging, migration, marriage patterns, and household changes. Additionally, it will be used to forecast the needs of various population groups and to plan and evaluate the effectiveness of social and economic policies.

Of particular importance is the availability of current population estimates at the rayon (ADM2) level, which will serve as the basis for extrapolating local-level (ADM4) demographic indicators necessary for targeted policy interventions.

This data will be used exclusively for analytical purposes, only the team preparing the analysis and officials from the Ministry of Economy will use it

message_content: I am taking a course as a graduate student and woud like to access this data on my research on refugees.
extras: {"country": "United States", "organization_id": "University of Pennsylvania", "organization_name": "University of Pennsylvania", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "93c52ec2-af4f-4c42-b289-47be54a087d7", "caveats": "The Whole of Afghanistan Assessment (WoAA 2020) implemented a quantitative methodology reliant upon approximately 12,592 household level surveys in accessible parts of Afghanistan from 04 August 2020 to 05 September 2020. The Covid-19 pandemic increased commodity prices, decreased livelihood opportunities, and strained Afghanistan\u2019s weak health and social service infrastructures. Given the generally poor mobile and WiFi services across Afghanistan and the particularly poor access that vulnerable and displaced populations have to mobile phones and computers, face to face interviews were conducted. However, in recognition of the \u201cDue No Harm\u201d and \u201cDuty of Care\u201d principles, new procedures and trainings were established to limit both field staff and respondent exposure to Covid-19, survey questions were limited to only those crucial to cluster planning, the confidence rate for the sampling was increased, and focus group discussions (FGDs) were eliminated. \r\nData collection was conducted using stratified cluster sampling with a 95/5 at national level for all population groups. To reduce gender bias, male-female enumerator pairs conducted assessments in provinces where it was feasible to do so. Male-female enumerator pairs interviewed one male member and one female member of each household, when possible, using the same questionnaire. Data from female Heads of Households (HoHs) and female interviewees was then used to complement and compare against male HoH and interviewee responses.", "creator_user_id": "26053c05-149a-404a-b250-94f0a0d8731e", "data_update_frequency": "-1", "dataset_date": "[2020-08-04T00:00:00 TO 2020-09-05T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "REACH Initiative", "field_names": "hoh_non_hoh,informal_settlement,refugees,pop_group,forcibly_displaced", "file_types": "EXCEL", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "b77838b8-0cbf-4d11-9b83-b2feb7035732", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-10-09T12:23:46.884934", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "d1a30c1e-a311-466d-a621-4191c9aa4ca5", "metadata_created": "2021-12-20T05:11:16.170925", "metadata_modified": "2024-10-09T12:23:46.884934", "methodology": "Sample Survey", "name": "whole-of-afghanistan-assessment-2020-dataset", "notes": "Whole of Afghanistan Multi-Sectorial Needs Assessment Conducted on Yearly Basis.", "num_of_rows": 16058, "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 3, "organization": {"id": "8e8911ab-f35c-4189-9dce-8715002f723e", "name": "reach-initiative", "title": "REACH Initiative", "type": "organization", "description": "REACH facilitates the development of information tools and products that enhance the capacity of aid actors to make evidence-based decisions in emergency, recovery and development contexts. message_content: I am in the process of preparing a proposal for the design of a wastewater treatment plant and sewer system in the Bucha near Kyiv. Therefore, accurate population data is required.
extras:
{"country": "Republic of Korea", "organization_id": "yooshin corporation", "organization_name": "yooshin corporation", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "private_sector", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2026-02-18T14:38:19", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-04-19T14:38:19", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 66, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content:
Good day,

I am a student from the University of Macedonia. I attempting to map the entirety of OCHA as it currently stands. I am aiming to determine the number of personnel, the positions within OCHA, the location of those positions and their responsibilities.

Is it possible to retrieve this information? I am familiar with the HQ organizational chart, but it appears information to "zoom in" on unit hierarchies and what not is not readily available online.

I would appreciate any suggestions, advice, or guidance you may have in this regard.

Thank you for your time.

Cheers.

message_content: My name is Sim ten Holt, and I am a Geo, Media & Design student at Aeres University of Applied Sciences in the Netherlands. For my thesis, I am researching the reconstruction of Aleppo after the Syrian civil war, focusing on mapping essential needs such as water, food, and security. Population density on administrive level 4 would really help me in my analysis.

message_content: Our organization is preparing a macroeconomic forecast for Ukraine up to 2040, including research on the labor market. This requires estimates of the current population of Ukraine

{"country": "Ukraine", "organization_id": "KSE Institute", "organization_name": "KSE Institute", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2026-02-18T14:38:19", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-04-19T14:38:19", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 85, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content: My PhD project focuses on the impact of integration policies on refugee mobility, economic opportunities, and well-being, specifically examining the case of South Sudanese refugees in Uganda and Ethiopia. At this stage, I am trying to gather as much relevant microdata as possible for the region to assess which datasets will be most suitable for my analysis. The Perception Survey Uganda 2020 could be valuable in helping me understand how refugees in Uganda perceive the assistance they receive, their sense of respect and welcome in the host country, and their trust in aid and service providers.
