{"country": "France", "organization_id": "Paris School of Economics", "organization_name": "Paris School of Economics", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2026-02-18T14:38:19", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-04-19T14:38:19", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 64, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content:
I am reaching out to request detailed information regarding humanitarian aid efforts in Yemen. I require this information for the following reasons:

Research and Reporting: I am currently conducting an analytical study on the humanitarian situation in Yemen and need accurate data on relief efforts and aid provided by local and international organizations.
Humanitarian Project Implementation: I am part of an organization/initiative working on providing humanitarian assistance, and I need up-to-date information on the most urgent needs and distribution mechanisms to ensure aid reaches those in greatest need.
Awareness and Advocacy: I am involved in media campaigns aimed at raising awareness about the humanitarian crisis in Yemen. Reliable information is essential to accurately represent the situation and encourage international support.

Best,
Murad

message_content:
Hello, my name is Jane and I am enrolled in a Masters program focused on Information Design. I have been working with the IOM's baseline reports all semester at the oblast & raion level, building data experiences/visualizations for my thesis project around the internal displacement in Ukraine since Feb/Mar 2022. 

It would be very valuable for me to work with the data at the deeper, Hromada level as it offers more insight into the new communities that are measured each round. Without insight into this level of data, I'm limited with how meaningful the insights in my data story can be: is the change in a given raion from one round to another due to displacement or the ability to measure displacement? These are very different insights and takeaways..

Thank you for considering. My family & husband's family are immigrants from both Ukraine and Russia so this topic is very close to home and personal, I am treating it with the utmost respect and I am happy to share the outcome of my work with you once it's complete.

{"country": "Denmark", "organization_id": "Danish Red Cross", "organization_name": "Danish Red Cross", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "red_cross_red_crescent", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2026-02-18T14:38:19", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-04-19T14:38:19", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 40, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content: I would like to request data on health facilities (hospitals, health centers, health facilities, clinics, and others) in Yemen, updated for the year 2025, in Excel format, with data on service levels, capacity, operating services, and any other data. This is to assess the ability of health facilities to respond to population needs and analyze the distribution of health services in relation to population distribution. As a specialist in Geographic Information Systems and Remote Sensing

These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-04-19T14:38:19", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 34, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

{"country": "China", "organization_id": "China University of Geosciences", "organization_name": "China University of Geosciences", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "caveats": "Contributors: Cruz Vermelha de. Timor-Leste (CVTL), Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, Civil Protection Timor Leste, Contributors to the OpenStreetMap 2023, OSM Community Timor Leste", "creator_user_id": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "data_update_frequency": "-2", "dataset_date": "[2023-09-11T00:00:00 TO 2023-09-23T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre, Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, OpenStreetMap Contributors", "field_names": "OSM building footprint,critical infrastructures,floods,early warning,flood impacts,capacities", "file_types": "Excel Table,Shapefile,JSON", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": true, "id": "d52028c5-3327-4cd4-8838-e445253b8f34", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "metadata_created": "2023-12-16T19:14:35.666815", "metadata_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "OpenStreetMap Field Data Collection using KoboCollect & OSM remote mapping through the HOTOSM Tasking Manager", "name": "anticipatory-mapping-timor-leste", "notes": "This data package contains field data collected during anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste. The data collection focused on completing critical infrastructure mapping in the focus areas, collecting information of historic flood events, flood impacts, and early warnings. 
This data package is available upon request only due to containing household-level information. However, all structural building data has been directly imported into OpenStreetMap and is openly accessible.

The project involved several key stages:

•	Initial updates and completion of building footprints in OpenStreetMap in focus areas via remote mapping using satellite imagery before commencing field mapping.

•	Comprehensive mapping of all critical infrastructure buildings in designated areas, gathering bbuilding attributes like building use, names, etc.

•	Collection of specific building features indicating susceptibility to floods or other hazards, such as minimum foundation height and building materials.

•	Additionally, qualitative information on buildings' flood history was collected where individuals were present (e.g., 'Has this building been flooded in the past?'

•	In the Manatuto area, a subset of residential buildings was mapped alongside all critical infrastructure buildings.


Field mapping activities covered the following areas and dates:

•	Manatuto: September 11th to 15th, 2023 (1479 critical infrastructure & residential buildings mapped)

•	Raimea: September 18th, 2023 (27 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Uma Berloic: September 19th, 2023 (36 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Pante Macassar: September 21st to 22nd, 2023 (218 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)


The data package includes the following files:

1_Timor-Leste_AA_mapping_all areas.xlsx: 
Contains all collected, georeferenced data in raw and cleaned formats, along with a codebook.
2_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Buildingfootprint.zip & 3_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Building_footprint.json: 
Contain collected data joined to the OSM building footprint, updated via satellite mapping before field activities.

4_TimorLeste_KoboForm_Questions.pdf: 
Displays the questions and answer options used in the KoboCollect questionnaire for field data collection on historic flood events, impacts, and early warnings.

5_Final_Datamodel_Koboform_TimorLeste_AAmapping.xls: 
This table contains the data structure of the KoboCollect questionnaire. Importing this file into the KoboCollect toolbox allows to replicate the data collection.
6_OSM_Data_Model.pdf: 
This table offers an overview of the OpenStreetMap (OSM) data model and tags used for anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste, detailing how geographic objects are tagged with keys (e.g., "building") and values (e.g., “residential”) to describe their attributes.

{"country": "United States", "organization_id": "Kent State University", "organization_name": "Kent State University", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "963ec38f-6513-487d-9d42-50683f4c7690", "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "365", "dataseries_name": "COD - Subnational Population Statistics", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "due_date": "2026-02-18T14:38:19", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-02-18T14:38:19.461438", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-04-19T14:38:19", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 51, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content: I am a British Citizen that was displaced to Poland from Kharkiv, Ukraine - and for upcoming third anniversary of my displacement, in the next few weeks, I would like to use this data set to create a visualisation in R.

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. message_content:
Hello! I am a 4th year undergraduate student at Princeton University conducting research as part of my Senior Thesis. I am building an improved model that can estimate the number of civilians displaced due to conflict by analyzing NASA's VIIRS (VNP46A2) Imager data, which takes photos of Syria at night and provides nighttime light data which indicate how much light is emanating from any given area in Syria. By analyzing the time series data provided over the course of a battle and pairing that analysis with known civilian displacement figures, I aim to improve over other models which seek the estimate IDP flow.

To further improve my model, I seek to work not only with raw displacement figures, but also displacement figures as a percentage of the pre-exodus population. Using all of this data, I plan to run a regression and implement more technical analyses of the time series data in order to produce a high-quality model.

Thank you for your consideration.

Rawand.

To use it as a baseline to compare with other Population data of Syria 
overall numbers and disaggregated figures.

HI has recently started its operations in Sudan, we'd like to be able to identify areas of interventions based on needs / severity. In particular Jebel Moon & Foro Baranga in WD are amongst the 9 localities listed in the HNRP as "catastrophic level", we'd like to drill down on these (and a few others as well).
Thanks for your support

These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-03-15T10:19:00", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 53, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

extras:
{"country": "Thailand", "organization_id": "none", "organization_name": "none", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "none", "intend": "Academic", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "caveats": "Contributors: Cruz Vermelha de. Timor-Leste (CVTL), Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, Civil Protection Timor Leste, Contributors to the OpenStreetMap 2023, OSM Community Timor Leste", "creator_user_id": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "data_update_frequency": "-2", "dataset_date": "[2023-09-11T00:00:00 TO 2023-09-23T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre, Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, OpenStreetMap Contributors", "field_names": "OSM building footprint,critical infrastructures,floods,early warning,flood impacts,capacities", "file_types": "Excel Table,Shapefile,JSON", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": true, "id": "d52028c5-3327-4cd4-8838-e445253b8f34", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "metadata_created": "2023-12-16T19:14:35.666815", "metadata_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "OpenStreetMap Field Data Collection using KoboCollect & OSM remote mapping through the HOTOSM Tasking Manager", "name": "anticipatory-mapping-timor-leste", "notes": "This data package contains field data collected during anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste. The data collection focused on completing critical infrastructure mapping in the focus areas, collecting information of historic flood events, flood impacts, and early warnings. 
This data package is available upon request only due to containing household-level information. However, all structural building data has been directly imported into OpenStreetMap and is openly accessible.

The project involved several key stages:

•	Initial updates and completion of building footprints in OpenStreetMap in focus areas via remote mapping using satellite imagery before commencing field mapping.

•	Comprehensive mapping of all critical infrastructure buildings in designated areas, gathering bbuilding attributes like building use, names, etc.

•	Collection of specific building features indicating susceptibility to floods or other hazards, such as minimum foundation height and building materials.

•	Additionally, qualitative information on buildings' flood history was collected where individuals were present (e.g., 'Has this building been flooded in the past?'

•	In the Manatuto area, a subset of residential buildings was mapped alongside all critical infrastructure buildings.


Field mapping activities covered the following areas and dates:

•	Manatuto: September 11th to 15th, 2023 (1479 critical infrastructure & residential buildings mapped)

•	Raimea: September 18th, 2023 (27 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Uma Berloic: September 19th, 2023 (36 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Pante Macassar: September 21st to 22nd, 2023 (218 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)


The data package includes the following files:

1_Timor-Leste_AA_mapping_all areas.xlsx: 
Contains all collected, georeferenced data in raw and cleaned formats, along with a codebook.
2_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Buildingfootprint.zip & 3_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Building_footprint.json: 
Contain collected data joined to the OSM building footprint, updated via satellite mapping before field activities.

4_TimorLeste_KoboForm_Questions.pdf: 
Displays the questions and answer options used in the KoboCollect questionnaire for field data collection on historic flood events, impacts, and early warnings.

5_Final_Datamodel_Koboform_TimorLeste_AAmapping.xls: 
This table contains the data structure of the KoboCollect questionnaire. Importing this file into the KoboCollect toolbox allows to replicate the data collection.
6_OSM_Data_Model.pdf:

message_content:
Hello,

I am a Master of Public Health Management student at the University of Cumbria, currently working on my dissertation. My research focuses on access to primary health services, and I am seeking relevant data to support my study.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,

Fuad

These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-03-15T10:19:00", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 80, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

I need this population data for humanitarian purposes (context analysis, assistance needs estimation). The last national census in Syria was in 2004. The online/publicly available statistics/forecasts on Syria's demographic profile are conflicting and not always reliable. Hence this request for the data. Be assured that it is to be used for humanitarian purposes only and will be kept confidential without any further circulation.

message_content:
Hello,

My name is Rawand Azîz, and I am an undergraduate student at Princeton University currently conducting research on estimating wartime populations and the number of displaced persons during crises, something which countries such as Syria face regularly. This research is my Senior Thesis project, and I aim to build a model which may be used by humanitarian organizations to be better prepared to address crises by having more accurate population or IDP estimates in a given city. I am building a model which uses various raw datasets (such as Facebook's Data for Good) and publicly-available data such as satellite images and night-time luminosity from satellite images provided by NASA, incorporating various statistical methods under the oversight of my advisor, Mark Cerenzia of Princeton's ORFE department.

This dataset, alongside its methodology, would be instrumental in aiding my research. I plan to use the dataset to compare against my model in order to measure its accuracy or variance from other estimates; in particular, I am interested in using it as an ingredient in the model if the methodology integrates well (i.e. without significant circular reasoning).

Thank you for your consideration. Please let me know if you require any further information.

Sincerely,

Rawand.

message_content:
I am conducting research on the displacement of people during wartime, with a focus on completely home damaged. I am reaching out to inquire if your organization could provide access to data or resources related to this topic.

If data sharing is possible, I would be happy to follow any required procedures or provide further details about the research.

Thank you for considering this request. I look forward to your response.

These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. message_content: Update/addition to the Ukraine gazetteer
extras:
{"country": "Germany", "organization_id": "privat", "organization_name": "privat", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "academic_research", "intend": "Update/addition to the Ukraine gazetteer", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "cod_level": "cod-enhanced", "creator_user_id": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "data_update_frequency": "-2", "dataset_date": "[2024-07-15T00:00:00 TO 2024-07-15T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)", "field_names": "SADD,Total Population,COD-AB reference data", "file_types": "Excel,PDF", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "8a3549d1-ca04-4c12-833e-05ef521b594e", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2025-01-08T09:58:37.041742", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "ee6e4f19-837f-4849-b164-80deab359fd8", "metadata_created": "2024-09-20T12:45:44.096037", "metadata_modified": "2025-01-08T09:58:37.041742", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "A technical accompanying note and an end-user release note (.pdf) have been prepared by UNFPA and will be provided with the data. These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 45, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "review_date": "2024-09-25T19:23:00.253351", "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": false, "update_status": "unknown", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content:
We are in the process of developing a response plan for displacement solutions. While we have collected some initial data, we recognize the need for more comprehensive information to support our decision-making.
To enhance our analysis, we would greatly benefit from the dataset we are requesting. Your assistance in providing this data would be invaluable to our efforts.

message_content:
Dear Team, 
I am a PhD researcher based in Geneva and studying at the Geneva Graduate Institute.
I am researching on refugees in Bangladesh. Therefore, for background research, I am requesting access to this data. Once the research has been done, I intend to share my research with you. For any questions, please do not hesitate to reach me at vaibhavi.sharma@graduateinstitute.ch.

Thanks
Yolanda

extras: {"country": "Afghanistan", "organization_id": "UNDP", "organization_name": "UNDP", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "united_nations", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "93c52ec2-af4f-4c42-b289-47be54a087d7", "caveats": "This Whole of Afghanistan Assessment (WoAA) implemented a mixed methodology, reliant upon approximately 30,000 household level surveys in accessible parts of Afghanistan, approximately 2,000 Key Informant Interviews (KIIs) in hard-to-reach districts, and on 68 Focus Group Discussions (FGDs) (two per province) to add understanding and breadth to unclear or unexplained quantitative findings. Detailed Secondary Data Review (SDR) was conducted in collaboration with the humanitarian community to identify pertinent information gaps, prior to the research design phase of this assessment, and to later guide analysis of results. All tools were designed by the Humanitarian Coordinated Assessment Working Group (HCAWG) with the support of REACH. Data was jointly collected by Cluster partner NGOs and members of the Agency Coordinating Body for Afghan Relief (ACBAR) Twinning Program, encouraging engagement with the data collection and supporting the integration of findings into NGO and Cluster sector-specific overviews and response strategies, as well as the Humanitarian Program Cycle (HPC). Analysis was a joint effort, through a Joint Analysis Workshop, in which relevant cluster coordination participated. extras: {"country": "Afghanistan", "organization_id": "UNDP", "organization_name": "UNDP", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "united_nations", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "batch": "93c52ec2-af4f-4c42-b289-47be54a087d7", "caveats": "The Whole of Afghanistan Assessment (WoAA 2020) implemented a quantitative methodology reliant upon approximately 12,592 household level surveys in accessible parts of Afghanistan from 04 August 2020 to 05 September 2020. The Covid-19 pandemic increased commodity prices, decreased livelihood opportunities, and strained Afghanistan\u2019s weak health and social service infrastructures. Given the generally poor mobile and WiFi services across Afghanistan and the particularly poor access that vulnerable and displaced populations have to mobile phones and computers, face to face interviews were conducted. However, in recognition of the \u201cDue No Harm\u201d and \u201cDuty of Care\u201d principles, new procedures and trainings were established to limit both field staff and respondent exposure to Covid-19, survey questions were limited to only those crucial to cluster planning, the confidence rate for the sampling was increased, and focus group discussions (FGDs) were eliminated. \r\nData collection was conducted using stratified cluster sampling with a 95/5 at national level for all population groups. To reduce gender bias, male-female enumerator pairs conducted assessments in provinces where it was feasible to do so. Male-female enumerator pairs interviewed one male member and one female member of each household, when possible, using the same questionnaire. Data from female Heads of Households (HoHs) and female interviewees was then used to complement and compare against male HoH and interviewee responses.", "creator_user_id": "26053c05-149a-404a-b250-94f0a0d8731e", "data_update_frequency": "-1", "dataset_date": "[2020-08-04T00:00:00 TO 2020-09-05T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "REACH Initiative", "field_names": "hoh_non_hoh,informal_settlement,refugees,pop_group,forcibly_displaced", "file_types": "EXCEL", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": false, "id": "b77838b8-0cbf-4d11-9b83-b2feb7035732", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-10-09T12:23:46.884934", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "d1a30c1e-a311-466d-a621-4191c9aa4ca5", "metadata_created": "2021-12-20T05:11:16.170925", "metadata_modified": "2024-10-09T12:23:46.884934", "methodology": "Sample Survey", "name": "whole-of-afghanistan-assessment-2020-dataset", "notes": "Whole of Afghanistan Multi-Sectorial Needs Assessment Conducted on Yearly Basis.", "num_of_rows": 16058, "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 3, "organization": {"id": "8e8911ab-f35c-4189-9dce-8715002f723e", "name": "reach-initiative", "title": "REACH Initiative", "type": "organization", "description": "REACH facilitates the development of information tools and products that enhance the capacity of aid actors to make evidence-based decisions in emergency, recovery and development contexts. message_content: I am working as the DRM Advisor to the Civil Protection Authority of Timor-Leste, and currently working to support them in enhancing the country's Contingency Plan for Flooding. Therefore, I would need this data and information to support the enhancement of the plan.

{"country": "Timor-Leste", "organization_id": "IOM Timor Leste", "organization_name": "IOM Timor Leste", "organization_member": false, "organization_type": "united_nations", "intend": "Humanitarian Assistance", "dataset_dict": {"archived": false, "author": null, "author_email": null, "caveats": "Contributors: Cruz Vermelha de. Timor-Leste (CVTL), Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, Civil Protection Timor Leste, Contributors to the OpenStreetMap 2023, OSM Community Timor Leste", "creator_user_id": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "data_update_frequency": "-2", "dataset_date": "[2023-09-11T00:00:00 TO 2023-09-23T23:59:59]", "dataset_preview": "first_resource", "dataset_source": "Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre, Open Mapping Hub Asia Pacific, OpenStreetMap Contributors", "field_names": "OSM building footprint,critical infrastructures,floods,early warning,flood impacts,capacities", "file_types": "Excel Table,Shapefile,JSON", "has_geodata": false, "has_quickcharts": false, "has_showcases": true, "id": "d52028c5-3327-4cd4-8838-e445253b8f34", "is_requestdata_type": true, "isopen": false, "last_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "license_title": null, "maintainer": "6b9fbd55-6752-4fd3-a306-49a7f5c1bf48", "metadata_created": "2023-12-16T19:14:35.666815", "metadata_modified": "2024-01-03T13:45:22.938114", "methodology": "Other", "methodology_other": "OpenStreetMap Field Data Collection using KoboCollect & OSM remote mapping through the HOTOSM Tasking Manager", "name": "anticipatory-mapping-timor-leste", "notes": "This data package contains field data collected during anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste. The data collection focused on completing critical infrastructure mapping in the focus areas, collecting information of historic flood events, flood impacts, and early warnings. 
This data package is available upon request only due to containing household-level information. However, all structural building data has been directly imported into OpenStreetMap and is openly accessible.

The project involved several key stages:

•	Initial updates and completion of building footprints in OpenStreetMap in focus areas via remote mapping using satellite imagery before commencing field mapping.

•	Comprehensive mapping of all critical infrastructure buildings in designated areas, gathering bbuilding attributes like building use, names, etc.

•	Collection of specific building features indicating susceptibility to floods or other hazards, such as minimum foundation height and building materials.

•	Additionally, qualitative information on buildings' flood history was collected where individuals were present (e.g., 'Has this building been flooded in the past?'

•	In the Manatuto area, a subset of residential buildings was mapped alongside all critical infrastructure buildings.


Field mapping activities covered the following areas and dates:

•	Manatuto: September 11th to 15th, 2023 (1479 critical infrastructure & residential buildings mapped)

•	Raimea: September 18th, 2023 (27 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Uma Berloic: September 19th, 2023 (36 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)

•	Pante Macassar: September 21st to 22nd, 2023 (218 critical infrastructure buildings mapped)


The data package includes the following files:

1_Timor-Leste_AA_mapping_all areas.xlsx: 
Contains all collected, georeferenced data in raw and cleaned formats, along with a codebook.
2_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Buildingfootprint.zip & 3_TL_AM_Data_joined_OSM_Building_footprint.json: 
Contain collected data joined to the OSM building footprint, updated via satellite mapping before field activities.

4_TimorLeste_KoboForm_Questions.pdf: 
Displays the questions and answer options used in the KoboCollect questionnaire for field data collection on historic flood events, impacts, and early warnings.

5_Final_Datamodel_Koboform_TimorLeste_AAmapping.xls: 
This table contains the data structure of the KoboCollect questionnaire. Importing this file into the KoboCollect toolbox allows to replicate the data collection.
6_OSM_Data_Model.pdf: 
This table offers an overview of the OpenStreetMap (OSM) data model and tags used for anticipatory mapping in Timor Leste, detailing how geographic objects are tagged with keys (e.g., "building") and values (e.g., “residential”) to describe their attributes.

message_content:
Dear colleagues,
We would like to access the humanitarian access data to present an overall aggregate figure across countries affected by conflict in a publication prepared jointly with WFP. We do not intend to present the data at the national level in the public domain.
Please let us know if this works with you.

message_content:
Hello,

I hope this message finds you well.

My name is Jalil Ahmad Rasoly, and I represent SAFE Organization. We are working on humanitarian projects in Afghanistan and conducting surveys to better understand the challenges faced by affected populations.

For our ongoing assessments, we are particularly interested in the Afghanistan—Humanitarian Access Incidents 2024 dataset to gain insights into the security and access challenges in the region. This will significantly contribute to the effectiveness of our interventions and allow us to plan and respond more effectively to the needs of those in critical situations.

I understand that the decision to grant access is at your discretion. If granted, we will handle the data in full compliance with any applicable licenses and instructions you provide.

Thank you for considering my request. I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Jalil Ahmad Rasoly
SAFE Organization
Email: jalil.rasoly@safeorganization-af.org

message_content: Hi, I'd like to include this in my donor reports and also upcoming proposals. I will give credit and cite them accordingly. Thanks

I would like to receive a high-level overview of trends in access constraints across the country during the past 12 months. I'd like to see geographic patterns and temporal trends. If this information is contained in an overview report or a monitoring update, that would be sufficient but I did not find relevant updates on ReliefWeb or humanitarianresponse.info. Thank you!

message_content:
I hope this message finds you well. I am Luis Remiro, a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Political Science at the University of Barcelona. I am currently engaged in a research project examining the impact of humanitarian conditions on political behaviour in Venezuelan municipalities.

For the purposes of this study, I am seeking municipal-level humanitarian data for Venezuela spanning the last 25 years. Any data your office could provide, including but not limited to health, education, and economic indicators at the municipal level, would be invaluable to our analysis.

Understanding that some data may be sensitive, I assure you that any information provided will be used strictly in accordance with ethical research guidelines and solely for academic purposes. If the data is not readily available for the full 25-year span, I would appreciate any available data segments at the municipal level.

Thank you for considering this request. I am hopeful that access to this data will contribute significantly to our understanding of the complex interplay between humanitarian conditions and political responses at the local level.

Please let me know if there are any forms or procedures I need to follow to facilitate access to the data. I look forward to your positive response.

Warm regards,
Luis Remiro

These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. message_content:
Was curious to know the location of PHCs and hospitals in Abyan and Shabwa governorates as part of our analysis of the offer of health services in these governorates. The coordinates will also help us understand the distance between the PHCs and the FL, to help us determine which may be priority and which may not be.

Thanks!

El municipio Ci\u00e9naga particularmente ha sido un territorio receptor de victimas del conflicto armado debido a su cercan\u00eda a la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta donde Grupos Armados No Estatales se resguardan estrat\u00e9gicamente para controlar el paso de tr\u00e1nsito entre varios departamentos donde se producen cultivos il\u00edcitos y los puertos al norte del pa\u00eds por donde salen estos productos. Ci\u00e9naga a su vez ha recibido un flujo migratorio de poblaci\u00f3n refugiada y migrante venezolana ya que es un territorio donde los costos de vida son relativamente bajos y queda ubicado cercano a territorios donde la producci\u00f3n agr\u00edcola es la principal actividad econ\u00f3mica y pueden encontrar empleo. Por otro lado, Ci\u00e9naga al estar delimitado en el costado occidental por la Ci\u00e9naga Grande y en el norte por el Mar Caribe, el municipio de Ci\u00e9naga se encuentra expuesto a los riesgos por variabilidad clim\u00e1tica que van de extremo a extremo. Por un lado, las temporadas de lluvias (fen\u00f3meno de la Ni\u00f1a) y las \u00e9pocas de huracanes tropicales en el oc\u00e9ano Atl\u00e1ntico ocasionan que anualmente la cabecera municipal presente inundaciones por crecimiento de la Ci\u00e9naga Grande y por erosi\u00f3n costera, lo cual deriva en victimas que pierden pertenencias dentro de sus viviendas e inclusive las mismas viviendas si estas est\u00e1n construidas de materiales inadecuados. Por otro lado, las \u00e9pocas de sequ\u00eda afectan las zonas rurales de Ci\u00e9naga ocasionando la muerte de cultivos y de animales. Una tercera problem\u00e1tica por inundaciones se presenta por las obras fallidas de drenaje y acueducto que ocasionan inundaciones en varios sectores del municipio.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 2, "organization": {"id": "8e8911ab-f35c-4189-9dce-8715002f723e", "name": "reach-initiative", "title": "REACH Initiative", "type": "organization", "description": "REACH facilitates the development of information tools and products that enhance the capacity of aid actors to make evidence-based decisions in emergency, recovery and development contexts. message_content:
We are updating the indicators for the World Inequality Database on Education (WIDE), accessible through https://www.education-inequalities.org/
The World Inequality Database on Education (WIDE) brings together data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), other national household surveys and learning assessments from over 160 countries. 
Having this household survey allows us to calculate more recent versions of these indicators. According to the questionnaire and available variables, we will be able to add disaggregations by region, sex, ethnicity, etc.

It also aims to understand specific needs and vulnerabilities of population groups, namely non-displaced households, returnees, internally displaced persons (IDPs) living in host communities, and IDPs living at sites. 

The needs assessment covers protection, health, mental health, WASH, Shelter and NFI, Education, food security, livelihoods and disabilities, as well as the perception of and satisfaction with humanitarian aid (AAP).

The 2022 MSNA was conducted through a statistically representative household survey across 66 accessible sub-prefectures (admin2) out of the 72 sub-prefectures of the country. The inaccessible sub-prefectures were evaluated using a Key Informant survey. In consultation with key humanitarian partners and actors, a joint set of indicators, questions, and answer choices were developed for the assessment of needs in the context of the Central African Republic. All surveys were conducted through face-to-face interviews, using the tablet-based Kobo Collect Open Data Kit (ODK) app.

Household data collection took place from July 20 to September 18, 2022. A total of 12,347 households were assessed after data cleaning. Data is statistically representative at a 92% confidence level and a +/- 10% margin of error with a buffer of 10% for the entire population on the level of sub-prefectures (admin2) and higher levels, and for specific population groups on the level of prefectures (admin1) and higher levels.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 8, "organization": {"id": "8e8911ab-f35c-4189-9dce-8715002f723e", "name": "reach-initiative", "title": "REACH Initiative", "type": "organization", "description": "REACH facilitates the development of information tools and products that enhance the capacity of aid actors to make evidence-based decisions in emergency, recovery and development contexts. message_content:
The International Charitable Foundation “Alliance for Public Health” is currently conducting a study titled "Analysis of the HIV Situation in Ukraine in the Context of the Full-Scale War." The research aims to examine the dynamics of the HIV epidemic and the provision of services during the ongoing war at both national and regional levels. A key component of the study includes population size estimates, which are critical for understanding the scope of the epidemic, allocating resources effectively, and planning targeted interventions.

The findings will inform targeted programs focused on mitigating the impact of the war, ensuring uninterrupted HIV services during emergencies, enhancing the effectiveness of the HIV response, and improving treatment outcomes in Ukraine under the current circumstances.

These two notes describe the input data, estimation and projection methods, and strengths and limitations of the resulting COD-PS update. These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. Dear colleagues,
We would like to access the REACH 2022 MSNA micro data at household level to produce a food security index and translate IPC 2022 data from number of individuals to number of households.
Please let us know.
Many thanks,
Aurélien Mellin

message_content: UNODC and UNWomen have a joint project in Afghanistan about mapping the facilities available for women in the country. We are trying to see the relationship between those facilities and other resources such as hospital or schools, so having a school dataset (even if at province level) would be very useful.

message_content: Following the request of Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine, we need to estimate whether subvention program facilitating broadband internet coverage in rural areas was successfull or not, and further form a list of localities to include in the next stage of the program, we need to have a number of parameters. Population is one of them. As official statistics on population is available only as for Jan2021, current population estimates at rayon (adm2) level will allow for extrapolation and estimates at localities level (adm4).

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. It is shared only with the Ukraine Humanitarian Country Team, UN Country Team in Ukraine, and the Government of Ukraine.", "num_resources": 0, "num_tags": 1, "organization": {"id": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "name": "ocha-ukraine", "title": "OCHA Ukraine", "type": "organization", "description": "United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in Ukraine.", "image_url": "", "created": "2015-06-11T18:38:28.045449", "is_organization": true, "approval_status": "approved", "state": "active"}, "overdue_date": "2026-01-18T00:16:05", "owner_org": "40cfa9c2-59b6-44c2-bd34-cf99ce438067", "package_creator": "shcheglov", "pageviews_last_14_days": 66, "private": false, "qa_completed": false, "review_date": "2024-09-25T19:23:00.253351", "solr_additions": "{"countries": ["Ukraine"]}", "state": "active", "subnational": "1", "title": "Ukraine: Subnational Population Statistics", "total_res_downloads": 8, "type": "dataset", "updated_by_script": "HDXINTERNAL:HDXPythonLibrary/6.2.0-CODs (2024-11-19T00:16:05.728973)", "url": null, "version": null, "groups": [{"description": "", "display_name": "Ukraine", "id": "ukr", "image_display_url": "", "name": "ukr", "title": "Ukraine"}], "tags": [{"display_name": "baseline population", "id": "db8205e9-b61c-4df7-a987-1a2658ed8666", "name": "baseline population", "state": "active", "vocabulary_id": "b891512e-9516-4bf5-962a-7a289772a2a1"}], "resources": [], "relationships_as_subject": [], "relationships_as_object": [], "is_fresh": true, "update_status": "fresh", "x_resource_grouping": []}}

message_content: I am exploring research on examining the impact of drought and natural shocks on household economic situation and food insecurity. I have access to WOAA 2019, 2020, 2022, but I was not able to find individual level records for the WOAA 2023 dataset. This will allow me to assess how has drought and natural shocks contributed to household economic situation.

message_content: I am looking to map the energy access in the West Bank for Palestinians. This is for a university dissertation that will use geospatial analysis to define and delineate the apartheid that is occurring in occupied Palestine.

message_content: Hello. I am currently working on a research project at Georgia State University in Atlanta within the GeoScience department regarding the impact of the Russian invasion on the civilian healthcare infrastructure. Your data would be used to assist in visualizing spatially the effects on healthcare facilities.
Hi there, I'm currently working in a project which this data would be very useful for validating my findings.

These notes are made available to end-users of the 2024 COD-PS update.", "name": "cod-ps-ukr", "notes": "![UNFPA Logo](https://data.humdata.org/image/2021-08-05-143409.352392UNFPA-logo.jpg)

Subnational Population Statistics are produced by and contributed to HDX by [UNFPA](https://data.humdata.org/organization/unfpa) and, in the case of Ukraine, are exceptionally shared by OCHA Ukraine with the approval of UNFPA.

The 2024 Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) update for Ukraine presents raion-level (ADM-2), oblast-level (ADM-1) and national-level (ADM-0) estimates of population size by sex and standard 5-year demographic age groups. The 2024 COD-PS update revises the 2023 COD-PS update and 2022 COD-PS update produced by UNFPA, by accounting for recent population change due to mobility, mortality and fertility dynamics.

This COD-PS update was prepared by the United Nations Population Fund, UNFPA. This update was prepared in consultation with the Humanitarian Country Team and UN Country Team in Ukraine, as well as national partners including the Institute for Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Ukraine and the State Statistics Service of Ukraine.

The 2024 COD-PS update, like all COD-PS updates, is strictly a humanitarian data product of the United Nations aligned to the "best available humanitarian data standard". It does not represent or, in any way, replace official statistics or official population projections of the Government of Ukraine and it is not intended to meet the international standards of official statistics.

The Ukraine Common Operational Dataset on Population Statistics (COD-PS) 2024 is a restricted dataset, in line with applicable national laws and the host country agreement with the United Nations. message_content: Over the past two years, the Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC) has been using data from the MSNAs to conduct research on the severity of internal displacement. Our research complements the figures in the Global Report on Internal Displacement, offering additional insights that help governments, humanitarian organisations, donors, and other key actors in prioritising their responses to displacement situations. This work aligns with OCHA's durable solutions framework, measuring progress in addressing specific displacement-related vulnerabilities that can prevent displaced people from accessing durable solutions. You can find the findings from our previous analyses on the IDMC Severity Assessments page. Accessing the full MSNA data from Sudan would allow us to fill in an important data gap and provide a more comprehensive overview of internal displacement dynamics in the country.
